instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan runs High all the time
threads.message:
I have a 2015 MacBook Air that runs "fine" other than the fan runs high as soon as you turn it on.

When it boots, Keyboard, trackpad, wifi, Bluetooth, etc.. all work the way they should (and doesn't seem to be running slowly.) I've looked over the board and don't see liquid damage (doesn't look like it's been cleaned either)

Usually I would run ASD to see if it fails any sensors, but I don't have an ASD for the 2015 air, and what I was reading online is that Apple has gone remote/GSX for their "ASD" for the newest machines.

Can anyone confirm this or know what would cause (I'm sure there are a thousand things) the fans to run on high?

Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan runs High all the time
threads.message: Hold down "D" and start the machine, it will run onboard diagnostics.

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan runs High all the time
threads.message:
Throws back PFM006 (SMC) and PPN001 (Power management system)

any ideas? Thanks for the hint about holding down D

thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan runs High all the time
threads.message:
And the machine's powers from battery and/or charger just fine. If the computer works this well, other than fan, would you suspect a bad SMC? PPN001 power management, I did just see some corrosion on the I/O board. Don't have a spare. Could an I/O board be causing all of this. The <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A looks super clean (there was some dust, etc... so I don't think it was cleaned)

thanks again

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan runs High all the time
threads.message: Yes, fin stack temp sensor is on IO board going through pin 11 and 13 of J9500.

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan runs High all the time
threads.message:
Okay, awesome. I'll replace the I/O and the cable and reportback.

thanks again!

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan runs High all the time
threads.message: Replaced the IO board and cable and no more loud fan! Running that self diag again to see if anything pops up anymore.

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan runs High all the time
threads.message:
ADP000 "No issues" ✔️

Feel free and close this topic, thanks!!!
